original: Majjhima Nikāya 12
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Mahāsīhanādasutta
analyzed: mahāsīhanādasutta
translated: The Greater Discourse on the Lion’s Roar

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati bahinagare aparapure vanasaṇḍe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati bahi nagare apara pure vana saṇḍe
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Vesālī, in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sunakkhatto licchaviputto acirapakkanto hoti imasmā dhammavinayā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sunakkhattaḥ licchavi putto acira pakkantaḥ hoti imasmai dhamma vinayā
translated: At that time Sunakkhatta, the son of the Licchavis, had recently left this spiritual practice.

original: So vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
analyzed: saḥ vesāliyam parisati evam vācam bhāsati
translated: And in Vesālī, in the assembly, he had said:

original: “natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
analyzed: natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana viseso
translated: “There is no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Takkapariyāhataṁ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ deseti vīmaṁsānucaritaṁ sayampaṭibhānaṁ.
analyzed: takka pariyāhatam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam deseti vīmasa anucaritam sayampaṭibhāna
translated: The ascetic Gotama teaches a Dhamma hammered out by reasoning, following his own line of inquiry as it occurs to him.

original: Yassa ca khvāssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
analyzed: yassa ca khvā assa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: And the Dhamma he teaches leads only to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and Nibbāna.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā sāriputto pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya vesālim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, when it was morning, the venerable Sāriputta dressed, and taking his bowl and outer robe, went into Vesālī for alms.

original: Assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsamānassa:
analyzed: assosi kho āyasmā sāriputto sunakkhattassa licchavi puttassa vesāliyam parisati evam vācam bhāsamānassa
translated: He heard that in Vesālī, in the assembly, Sunakkhatta, the son of the Licchavis, had said:

original: “natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
analyzed: natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana viseso
translated: ‘There is no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones for the ascetic Gotama.

original: Takkapariyāhataṁ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ deseti vīmaṁsānucaritaṁ sayampaṭibhānaṁ.
analyzed: takka pariyāhatam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam deseti vīmasa anucaritam sayampaṭibhāna
translated: The ascetic Gotama teaches a Dhamma hammered out by reasoning, following his own line of inquiry as it occurs to him.

original: Yassa ca khvāssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto
analyzed: yassa ca khvā assa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati  atha kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ vesāliyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkanto
translated: And the Dhamma he teaches leads only to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and Nibbāna.’

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then, after wandering for alms in Vesālī and returning from his almsround, after his meal he set his resting place in order and taking his bowl and outer robe set out on a wandering tour toward the country of the Videhans.🔽Wandering by stages, he eventually arrived at the country of the Videhans and there he lived in the vicinity of a brāhmaṇa village called Kolita.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: There he approached a certain brāhmaṇa and said to him:

original: “sunakkhatto, bhante, licchaviputto acirapakkanto imasmā dhammavinayā.
analyzed: sunakkhattaḥ bhante licchavi putto acira pakkantaḥ imasmai dhamma vinayā
translated: ‘Sunakkhatta, the son of the Licchavīs, has recently left this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: So vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
analyzed: saḥ vesāliyam parisati evam vācam bhāsati
translated: He spoke in dispraise of the Dhamma and Discipline and in dispraise of me.

original: ‘natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussadhammā alamariyañāṇadassanaviseso.
analyzed: natthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussa dhammāḥ alam ariya ñāṇa dassana viseso
translated: ‘There is no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones for the ascetic Gotama.

original: Takkapariyāhataṁ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṁ deseti vīmaṁsānucaritaṁ sayampaṭibhānaṁ.
analyzed: takka pariyāhatam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammam deseti vīmasa anucaritam sayampaṭibhāna
translated: The ascetic Gotama teaches a Dhamma hammered out by reasoning, following his own line of inquiry as it occurs to him.

original: Yassa ca khvāssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’”ti.
analyzed: yassa ca khvā assa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: And the Dhamma he teaches when he has discovered it leads to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to stilling, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Nibbāna.’

original: “Kodhano heso, sāriputta, sunakkhatto moghapuriso.
analyzed: kodhanaḥ ha iso sāriputta sunakkhatto mogha puriso
translated: “Sāriputta, that foolish man Sunakkhatta is angry.

original: Kodhā ca panassa esā vācā bhāsitā.
analyzed: kodhā ca panassa esā vācā bhāsitā
translated: And he spoke that speech out of anger.

original: ‘Avaṇṇaṁ bhāsissāmī’ti kho, sāriputta, sunakkhatto moghapuriso vaṇṇaṁyeva tathāgatassa bhāsati.
analyzed: avaṇṇam bhāsissāmi iti kho sāriputta sunakkhatto mogha purisaḥ vaṇṇayā iva tathāgatassa bhāsati
translated: ‘I will speak dispraise of him’—but Sunakkhatta, the foolish man, spoke only praise of the Tathāgata.

original: Vaṇṇo heso, sāriputta, tathāgatassa yo evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ha iso sāriputta tathāgatassa yaḥ evam vadeyya
translated: For this is praise of the Tathāgata:

original: ‘yassa ca khvāssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti.
analyzed: yassa ca khvā assa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: ‘And the Dhamma he teaches when he has discovered it leads to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to stilling, to direct knowledge, to self-awakening, to Nibbāna.’

original: Ayampi hi nāma, sāriputta, sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhammanvayo na bhavissati:
analyzed: ayam pi hi nāma sāriputta sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhamma nvayaḥ na bhavissati
translated: “Sāriputta, even this much is not granted to that foolish man Sunakkhatta:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi, satthā devamanussānaṁ, buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussāna buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Ayampi hi nāma, sāriputta, sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhammanvayo na bhavissati:
analyzed: ayam pi hi nāma sāriputta sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhamma nvayaḥ na bhavissati
translated: Even this, Sāriputta, is a reason why the foolish, incompetent, bad man should not be admitted to the Order.

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti,
analyzed: iti pi so bhagavā aneka vihitam iddhividham paccanubhoti ekaḥ api hutvā bahudhā
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord has various kinds of psychic power. Having been one he becomes many;

original: bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti; āvibhāvaṁ, tirobhāvaṁ; tirokuṭṭaṁ tiropākāraṁ tiropabbataṁ🔽asajjamāno gacchati, seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṁ karoti, seyyathāpi🔽udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gacchati, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṁ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamati,
analyzed: bahudhā api hutvā ekaḥ hoti āvi bhāva tirobhāva tirokuṭṭam tiro pākāram tiro pabbata  a sajjamānaḥ gacchati sā iyathā api ākāse pathaviyā api ummujja nimujjam karoti sā iyathā api  udake udake pi abhijjamāne gacchati seyyathā api pathaviye ākāse pi pallaṅkena kamati
translated: having been many he becomes one. He appears and disappears.

original: seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve pāṇinā
analyzed: seyyathā api pakkhī sakuṇaḥ ime api candima sūriye eva mahiddhike eva mahā anubhāve pāṇinā
translated: He goes unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, as though through space. He dives in and out of the earth as though in water. He goes on unbroken water as though on earth. Seated cross-legged he travels through space. With his hand he touches and strokes even the sun and moon, mighty and powerful as they are.

original: parimasati parimajjati; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vattetī’ti.
analyzed: parimasati parimajjati yāva brahma lokā api kāyena vasam vatta iti iti
translated: and can make his body appear as far as the Brahma world.’

original: Ayampi hi nāma, sāriputta, sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhammanvayo na bhavissati:
analyzed: ayam pi hi nāma sāriputta sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhamma nvayaḥ na bhavissati
translated: But even this, Sāriputta, will not be a reason for the worthless Sunakkhatta to believe in me,🔽that ‘The Fortunate One has the divine eye, which is purified, and surpasses that of (normal) men, and sees beings passing away and reappearing, and understands how beings pass on according to their actions:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāti—dibbe ca mānuse ca, ye dūre santike cā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāti dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike ca ati
translated: ‘This person, after passing away from here, reappears in a good destination, in the heavenly world, and there he rejoices, experiencing the pleasures of heavenly beings.’

original: Ayampi hi nāma, sāriputta, sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhammanvayo na bhavissati:
analyzed: ayam pi hi nāma sāriputta sunakkhattassa moghapurisassa mayi dhamma nvayaḥ na bhavissati
translated: But even this, Sāriputta, will not be a reason for the worthless Sunakkhatta to believe in me,

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti—🔽sarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ sarāgaṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: iti pi so bhagavā para sattānam para puggalānam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāti  sa rāgam vā cittam sa rāgam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: that ‘The Fortunate One understands the minds of other beings, of other persons, having encompassed them with his own mind:🔽he understands a mind with passion as a mind with passion,

original: vītarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ vītarāgaṁ cittanti pajānāti;🔽sadosaṁ vā cittaṁ sadosaṁ cittanti pajānāti,🔽vītadosaṁ vā cittaṁ vītadosaṁ cittanti pajānāti;
analyzed: vīta rāgam vā cittam vīta rāgam cittam iti pajānāti  sa dosam vā cittam sa dosam cittam iti pajānāti  vīta dosam vā cittam vīta dosam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: and he understands a mind without passion as a mind without passion;🔽he understands a mind with hatred as a mind with hatred,🔽and he understands a mind without hatred as a mind without hatred;

original: samohaṁ vā cittaṁ samohaṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: sa moham vā cittam sa moham cittam iti pajānāti
translated: he understands a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion,🔽and he understands a mind without delusion as a mind without delusion;

original: vītamohaṁ vā cittaṁ vītamohaṁ cittanti pajānāti;🔽saṅkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ saṅkhittaṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: vīta moham vā cittam vīta moham cittam iti pajānāti  saṅkhittam vā cittam saṅkhittam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: a mind without delusion as a mind without delusion,

original: vikkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ vikkhittaṁ cittanti pajānāti;🔽mahaggataṁ vā cittaṁ mahaggataṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: vikkhittam vā cittam vikkhittam cittam iti pajānāti  mahaggatam vā cittam mahaggatam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: a contracted mind as contracted,🔽a distracted mind as distracted,

original: amahaggataṁ vā cittaṁ amahaggataṁ cittanti pajānāti;🔽sauttaraṁ vā cittaṁ sauttaraṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: a mahaggatam vā cittam a mahaggatam cittam iti pajānāti  sauttaram vā cittam sauttaram cittam iti pajānāti
translated: a superior mind as superior,🔽an unexcelled mind as unexcelled,🔽a mind with higher wisdom as with higher wisdom,

original: anuttaraṁ vā cittaṁ anuttaraṁ cittanti pajānāti;🔽samāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ samāhitaṁ cittanti pajānāti,🔽asamāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ asamāhitaṁ cittanti pajānāti;
analyzed: anuttaram vā cittam anuttaram cittam iti pajānāti  samāhitam vā cittam samāhitam cittam iti pajānāti  a samāhitam vā cittam a samāhitam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: a mind without higher wisdom as without higher wisdom,🔽a concentrated mind as concentrated,🔽an unconcentrated mind as unconcentrated,

original: vimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ vimuttaṁ cittanti pajānāti,
analyzed: vimuttam vā cittam vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: a liberated mind as liberated,

original: avimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ avimuttaṁ cittanti pajānātī’ti.
analyzed: a vimuttam vā cittam a vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti iti
translated: and an unliberated mind as unliberated.’

original: Dasa kho panimāni, sāriputta, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalāni yehi balehi samannāgato tathāgato āsabhaṁ ṭhānaṁ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṁ nadati, brahmacakkaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: dasa kho panimāni sāriputta tathāgatassa tathāgata balāni yehi balehi samannāgataḥ tathāgataḥ āsabham ṭhānam paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati brahmacakkam pavatteti
translated: “Sāriputta, there are these ten powers of a Tathāgata. Possessing these powers, the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull,🔽roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and sets rolling the Wheel of Brahmā.

original: Katamāni dasa?🔽Idha, sāriputta, tathāgato ṭhānañca ṭhānato aṭṭhānañca aṭṭhānato yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.🔽Yampi, sāriputta, tathāgato ṭhānañca ṭhānato aṭṭhānañca aṭṭhānato yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: katamāni dasa  idha sāriputta tathāgataḥ ṭhānañca ṭhānataḥ aṭṭhānañca aṭṭhānataḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti  yam pi sāriputta tathāgataḥ ṭhānañca ṭhānataḥ aṭṭhānañca aṭṭhānataḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: What are the ten?🔽“Here, Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible.

original: idampi, sāriputta, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṁ hoti yaṁ balaṁ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṁ🔽ṭhānaṁ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṁ nadati, brahmacakkaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: idam pi sāriputta tathāgatassa tathāgata balam hoti yam balam āgamma tathāgataḥ  ṭhānam paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati brahmacakkam pavattā iti
translated: “Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the result of the undertaking of action that is past, future, and present in terms of possibilities and causes.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, tathāgato atītānāgatapaccuppannānaṁ kammasamādānānaṁ ṭhānaso hetuso vipākaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta tathāgataḥ atīta anāgata paccuppannānam kamma samādānānam ṭhānasaḥ hetusaḥ vipākam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the world’s manifold elements.

original: Yampi, sāriputta, tathāgato atītānāgatapaccuppannānaṁ kammasamādānānaṁ ṭhānaso hetuso🔽vipākaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, idampi, sāriputta, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṁ hoti
analyzed: yam pi sāriputta tathāgataḥ atīta anāgata paccuppannānam kamma samādānānam ṭhānasaḥ hetusaḥ  vipākam yathābhūtam pajānāti idam pi sāriputta tathāgatassa tathāgata balam hoti
translated: “Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the result of past, future, and present volitional activities in terms of possibilities and causes.🔽This, Sāriputta, is a Tathāgata’s power of the Tathāgata,

original: yaṁ balaṁ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṁ ṭhānaṁ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṁ nadati,🔽brahmacakkaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: yam balam āgamma tathāgataḥ āsabham ṭhānam paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati  brahma cakkam pavatta iti
translated: possessing which the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull,🔽roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and sets rolling the Wheel of Brahmā.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, tathāgato sabbatthagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.🔽Yampi, sāriputta, tathāgato sabbatthagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, idampi,
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta tathāgataḥ sabbattha gāminim paṭipadam yathābhūtam pajānāti  yam pi sāriputta tathāgataḥ sabbattha gāminim paṭipadam yathābhūtam pajānāti idam pi
translated: “Again, Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the way leading to the goal.🔽This, Sāriputta, is a Tathāgata’s power of the Tathāgata,

original: sāriputta, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṁ hoti yaṁ balaṁ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṁ ṭhānaṁ
analyzed: sāriputta tathāgatassa tathāgata balam hoti yam balam āgamma tathāgataḥ āsabham
translated: possessing which the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull,

original: paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṁ nadati, brahmacakkaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati brahmacakkam pavatta iti
translated: roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and sets rolling the Wheel of Brahmā.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, tathāgato anekadhātunānādhātulokaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta tathāgataḥ aneka dhātu nānā dhātu lokam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “Again, Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the world with its many and various elements.

original: Yampi, sāriputta, tathāgato anekadhātunānādhātulokaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, idampi,
analyzed: yam pi sāriputta tathāgataḥ aneka dhātu nānā dhātu lokam yathābhūtam pajānāti idam pi
translated: “Sāriputta, the Tathāgata understands as it really is the world with its many and different elements.🔽This, Sāriputta, is a Tathāgata’s power,

original: sāriputta, tathāgatassa tathāgatabalaṁ hoti yaṁ balaṁ āgamma tathāgato āsabhaṁ ṭhānaṁ
analyzed: sāriputta tathāgatassa tathāgata balam hoti yam balam āgamma tathāgataḥ āsabham
translated: having attained which the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull,

original: paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṁ nadati, brahmacakkaṁ pavatteti.
analyzed: paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati brahmacakkam pavatta iti

original: sāriputta, na samanupassāmi.

translated: I do not see that reason.

translated: Not seeing that reason, I abide secure, fearless, & self-confident.

translated: ‘But the Dhamma that you teach is not capable of leading to the complete ending of suffering, to the right ending of suffering.’

translated: I do not see that fact on account of which they might do so.

translated: Not seeing that fact, I abide in safety, in security, in confidence, without fear or trembling.

analyzed: imāni kho sāriputta cattāri tathāgatassa vesārajjāni yehi vesārajjehi samannāgataḥ tathāgataḥ āsabham ṭhānam paṭijānāti parisāsu sīha nādam nadati brahmacakkam pavatteti
translated: These, Sāriputta, are the four kinds of fearlessness that the Tathāgata has, possessing which he claims the herd-leader’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and sets rolling the Wheel of Brahmā.

translated: “Sāriputta, if anyone knowing and seeing thus,

analyzed: tam vācam appahāya tam cittam appahāya tam diṭṭhim ap paṭinissajjitvā yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam niraye
translated: Just as a monk endowed with virtue, concentration, and wisdom might attain to the state of a non-returner in this very life, so it is with the one who doesn’t give up that speech, that thought, and that view. He will be cast into hell as if carried there on a litter.

original: imā kho, sāriputta, aṭṭha parisā.
analyzed: imā kho sāriputta aṭṭha parisā

translated: Sāriputta, I see no reason for that, and so I live secure, fearless, and confident.

translated: I do not see that sign, Sāriputta, for which I might be afraid or might be fearful.

translated: ‘The recluse Gotama’s doctrine is based on nothingness. He teaches his Dhamma for the sake of nothingness and leads his disciples to it,’

translated: Without abandoning that speech, without abandoning that thought, without abandoning that view, he will be set to rise up in hell.

translated: ‘There is no superhuman distinction, no distinction in true knowledge and conduct, no manifestation of a distinction in knowledge and conduct, in the Lord Gotama’s dispensation, for the sake of which the Lord Gotama’s disciples lead the holy life under him,’

translated: “Sāriputta, just as a bhikkhu possessed of virtue, concentration, and wisdom might here and now attain final knowledge, so it is with such a mode of progress that I survey the world with the eye of a Buddha.

translated: “Sāriputta, there are these five destinations.

analyzed: na kho pana ita sāriputta evam daṭṭhabba
translated: But, Sāriputta, that is not the way to see it.

original: Ahaṁ kho pana, sāriputta, etarahi jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko me vayo vattati.
analyzed: aham kho pana sāriputta etarahi jiṇṇaḥ vuddhaḥ mahallakaḥ addha gataḥ vayaḥ anuppattaḥ āsītikaḥ me vayaḥ vattati
translated: I am now old, aged, burdened with years, advanced in life, and come to the last stage; I am eighty years old.🔽Suppose I had four disciples who lived a hundred years,

original: Idha me assu, sāriputta, cattāro sāvakā vassasatāyukā vassasatajīvino, paramāya satiyā ca gatiyā ca dhitiyā ca samannāgatā paramena ca paññāveyyattiyena.
analyzed: idha me assu sāriputta cattāro sāvakā vassa sata āyukā vassa sata jīvino paramāya satiyā ca gatiyā ca dhitiyā ca samannāgatā paramena ca paññā veyyattiyena
translated: and with supreme mindfulness, supreme attentiveness, supreme memory, and supreme concentration,🔽just as a skilled archer, trained, practiced, and tested,

original: Seyyathāpi, sāriputta, daḷhadhammā dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho katūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasireneva tiriyaṁ tālacchāyaṁ atipāteyya,
analyzed: seyyathā api sāriputta daḷha dhammā dhanuggahaḥ sikkhitaḥ kata hatthaḥ kata upāsanaḥ lahukena asanena appa kasirena iva tiriyam tāla chāyam atipāteyya
translated: could shoot a light arrow across the shadow of a palm tree,

original: evaṁ adhimattasatimanto evaṁ adhimattagatimanto evaṁ adhimattadhitimanto evaṁ paramena paññāveyyattiyena samannāgatā.
analyzed: evam adhimatta satimantaḥ evam adhimatta gatimantaḥ evam adhimatta dhitimantaḥ evam paramena paññā veyyattiyena samannāgatā
translated: so too, with supreme mindfulness, supreme attentiveness, supreme memory, and supreme concentration,

original: Te maṁ catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ upādāyupādāya pañhaṁ puccheyyuṁ, puṭṭho puṭṭho cāhaṁ
analyzed: te mam catunnam sati paṭṭhānānam upādāya upādāya pañham puccheyyu puṭṭhaḥ puṭṭhaḥ ca āha
translated: they asked me about the four establishments of mindfulness, and I answered them, answering one question with one answer,

original: tesaṁ byākareyyaṁ, byākatañca me byākatato dhāreyyuṁ, na ca maṁ dutiyakaṁ uttari paṭipuccheyyuṁ.
analyzed: tesam byākareyya byākatam ca me byākatataḥ dhāreyyu na ca mama dutiyakam uttari paṭipuccheyyu
translated: and they would remember what I said and not question me further.

original: Aññatra asitapītakhāyitasāyitā aññatra uccārapassāvakammā, aññatra niddākilamathapaṭivinodanā🔽apariyādinnāyevassa, sāriputta, tathāgatassa dhammadesanā, apariyādinnaṁyevassa tathāgatassa
analyzed: aññatra asita pīta khāyita sāyitā aññatra uccāra passāva kammā aññatra niddā kilamatha paṭivinodanā  apariyādinnāyevassa sāriputta tathāgatassa dhamma desanā apariyādinnayevassa tathāgatassa
translated: Apart from eating, drinking, chewing and tasting; apart from defecating and urinating; apart from sleeping, drowsiness and languor;🔽the teaching of the Tathagata is inexhaustible,

original: dhammapadabyañjanaṁ, apariyādinnaṁyevassa tathāgatassa pañhapaṭibhānaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma pada byañjana apariyādinnayevassa tathāgatassa pañha paṭibhāna
translated: the words and phrases of the Tathagata are inexhaustible, the answers to questions of the Tathagata are inexhaustible.

original: Atha me te cattāro sāvakā vassasatāyukā vassasatajīvino vassasatassa accayena kālaṁ kareyyuṁ.
analyzed: atha me te cattāro sāvakāḥ vassa sata āyukāḥ vassa sata jīvinaḥ vassa satassa accayena kālam kareyyu
translated: Then those four disciples of mine, who lived for a hundred years, who were a hundred years old, would die.

original: Mañcakena cepi maṁ, sāriputta, pariharissatha, nevatthi tathāgatassa paññāveyyattiyassa aññathattaṁ.
analyzed: mañcakena ce pi ma sāriputta pariharissatha na iva atthi tathāgatassa paññāveyyattiyassa aññathatta
translated: Even if you were to carry me around on a couch, Sāriputta, there would be no change in the Tathagata’s wisdom and understanding.

original: Yaṁ kho taṁ, sāriputta, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: yam kho ta sāriputta sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: If anyone were to say rightly:

original: ‘asammohadhammo satto loke uppanno bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti, mameva taṁ sammā vadamāno vadeyya
analyzed: asammoha dhammaḥ sattaḥ loke uppannaḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti mama eva tam sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: ‘A being has appeared in the world for the welfare and happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.’

original: ‘asammohadhammo satto loke uppanno bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’”ti.
analyzed: asammoha dhammaḥ sattaḥ loke uppannaḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti
translated: ‘A being has appeared in the world for the welfare and happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.’”

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgasamālo bhagavato piṭṭhito ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgasamālaḥ bhagavataḥ piṭṭhitaḥ ṭhitaḥ hoti bhagavantam bījayamāno
translated: On that occasion Venerable Nāgasamāla was standing behind the Buddha, fanning him.

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgasamālo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā nāgasamālaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said to the Buddha,

original: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante
translated: “It’s astonishing and amazing, Sir,

original: Api hi me, bhante, imaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ sutvā lomāni haṭṭhāni.
analyzed: api hi me bhante imam dhammapariyāyam sutvā lomāni haṭṭhāni
translated: that even on hearing this teaching my hairs haven’t stood on end.

original: Konāmo ayaṁ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo”ti?
analyzed: konāmaḥ aya bhante dhammapariyāyo ti
translated: What’s the name of this teaching?”

original: “Tasmātiha tvaṁ, nāgasamāla, imaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ lomahaṁsanapariyāyotveva naṁ dhārehī”ti.
analyzed: tasmāt ati ha tva nāga samāle imam dhamma pariyāyam lomahasana pariyāyā utu eva nam dhārehi iti
translated: “Well then, Nāgasamāla, you should remember this teaching as ‘The Hairs on End.’”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Buddha said.

original: Attamano āyasmā nāgasamālo bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
analyzed: āyasmā nāgasamālaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti
translated: and the venerable Nāgasamāla was uplifted and greatly rejoiced in what was said by the Fortunate One.

original: Mahāsīhanādasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: mahāsīhanāda suttam niṭṭhitam dutiya
translated: and the venerable Nāgasamāla was uplifted and greatly rejoiced in what was said by the Fortunate One.
